name: Tillandsia 'Eric Knobloch'
description: Tillandsia 'Eric Knobloch' (Tillandsia brachycaulos × Tillandsia streptophylla) is a hybrid epiphytic bromeliad (air plant) created by crossing Tillandsia brachycaulos and Tillandsia streptophylla. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and features upright rosettes (15-30 cm tall) with medium-sized, dramatic, lance-shaped to curled, dark green to gray-green leaves with distinctive dense trichomes (scales) that give it a fuzzy, silvery appearance. The plant displays an upright rosette growth habit. Trichomes not only absorb moisture but also reflect light, giving many species a silvery or fuzzy appearance that helps reduce water loss. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds natural beauty with its distinctive fuzzy appearance. It's popular among air plant enthusiasts for its attractive foliage and turns bright red when blooming.
careTips: Mist regularly or soak in water weekly
Allow to dry completely after watering
Can be mounted on driftwood, bark, or other supports
